Can Indian Economy expect revival despite rising inflation? What do you think are the major steps that can be taken in present circumstances to push growth in the country?

Yes. Indian economy is going to boost up in the further years and there exists no doubt in this regard inspite of high inflation existing in the country.There has been a significant positive growth within the past 6 months. The clear reason behind this strong view is the rupee appreciation against the dollar.

                The major step that helps out the economy in this particular situation is the entry of FDI at a greater proportion but at the same time not exceeding the limits which may curb the domestic companies growth.This idea will put the economy in a protective status and thereby ensures greater pace in the nation's growth.

                 The recent guidelines and suggestions laid by the current RBI governor Rangarajan has cut down the inflation to a considerable extent. The public sector banks and the reserve bank should work in cooperation with each other which serves as a best technique to decrease the inflation in the country .The cohesive force thus formed wil be able to tackle the situation in a better way, with changes in the aspects of CRR and SLR ratios and maintaining them at a suitable proportion out of total.

                 The next step that should be taken is the avoidance of FII ( Foreign institutional investors ) into the country, because the inflow of FII will bring about drastic inclines and declines in the growth of an economy which in turn depicts a picture of irregularity in the growth.

                  Apart from all the circumstances prevailing in the country , the recent reforms by the new governor are showing a positive impact in the nation's growth. So better days are going to come very soon.
